An AI use case refers to a specific instance when someone uses an AI tool to solve a problem, fulfill a need, enhance a process, or create something new. You can use AI in many situations, job functions, personal projects, and industries to achieve your goals or improve your business operations. As weâll explore in this article, artificial intelligence use cases can range from understanding your customers better to optimizing energy distribution based on supply and demand.Â Discover ways companies use AI, different use cases across industries, and how to leverage AI to its full capabilities.Â How are companies using AI? As AI technology expands and becomes mainstream, companies leverage AI tools to improve operations on multiple levels, from cybersecurity to customer relationship management (CRM) .Â According to a Forbes Advisor survey of 600 business owners in the United States, the following are the percentages of how they use AI [ 1 ]: Customer service : 56% Cybersecurity and fraud management : 51% Digital personal assistants : 47% Customer relationship management : 46% Inventory management : 40% Content production : 35% Product recommendations : 33% Forbes Advisor also revealed that almost all surveyed business owners believe ChatGPT will help their business. At the same time, business owners have the following concerns: Will AI affect website traffic? Will businesses start to depend too heavily on technology?Â AI ethics As artificial intelligence (AI) becomes increasingly important to society, experts in the field have identified a need for ethical boundaries when it comes to creating and implementing new AI tools. AI ethics are the moral principles that companies use to guide responsible and fair development and use of AI. Learn more in the article, â AI Ethics: What It Is and Why It Matters . 53 AI use cases: a categorized list Weâve compiled a list of use cases for AI across industries to show how it can transform businesses and benefit society. How to expand your use of AIÂ Using AI more extensively can be exciting and rewarding, especially considering the range of use cases across industries and business functions. Here are some ways to expand your use of AI.Â Â 1. Deepen your knowledge of AI.Â Understanding AI tools, how they work, and the principles behind AI is important for leveraging AI capabilities. To deepen your AI skills and knowledge, you can take courses like Googleâs Introduction to Generative AI or IBMâs Introduction to Artificial Intelligence , participate in workshops and boot camps, or read the latest research on AI.Â 2. Launch AI projects.Â Designing and launching your AI projects is a great way to get hands-on experience with this technology and apply your knowledge to real-world situations. Projects can be for personal or professional use. Examples include building AI applications, developing customer service chatbots, and contributing to open-source projects on GitHub . You can also complete projects without developing AI models from scratch. For example, you can install a pre-built chatbot on your website, use predictive analytics tools to create sales forecasts or enhance images with AI-based filters. 3. Network with other AI professionals or enthusiasts.Â Networking can be a great way to participate in meaningful conversations about AI, get feedback on projects you may be working on, connect with collaborators, or learn about AI-related career opportunities . To network effectively, you can join online forums and communities devoted to AI, follow AI experts on social media, and reach out to them directly. Consider joining professional AI associations, attending hackathons and workshops, or even starting your own AI meetup in your area.Â 4. Apply AI in your industry.Â Investigate AI use cases in your industry and consider finding a way to apply AI to your career field. This can be a great way to make a positive impact on others and discover opportunities to advance your career, using the latest technology.Â Explore AI with Coursera Online courses provide a great way to explore AI use cases and gain hands-on experience with AI tools.
